PAD_Return.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Return.text: Dead goblins over there. Worth checking for supplies maybe.

session_synopses.PAD_Return: Arriving at a juncture in a path, companion Shadowheart points out an opportunity to look for supplies.

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: That you, Gimblebock? Everything all right out there?
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's reacting to them trying to open it and thinks they're his accomplice, a gnome called Gimblebock (ɡɪmbəl-bock)

EntranceDoor.speaker: Player
EntranceDoor.text: Gimblebock triggered some trap. He needs help - now!

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: I told him it wasn't safe out there. Get inside, and I'll rustle up some bandages...
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just lied to him, telling him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured in a trap. He's annoyed and a little concerned that this has happened and prepares to unlock the door

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Hells. Pity you aren't as good at graverobbing as you are at excuses.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Just being careful. Like my mum always said, fools rush in.

VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart.text: What, you got it open, just like that...?
VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous/exasperated: she's just witnessed someone easily open a door that she's been trying to break down the last while.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: ...You're both twice as tall as me but have half the bloody backbone!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minionsNodeContext: Angry, domineering. Short-tempered gang boss berating his underling's caution.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: Whoever was flying that thing can't have survived - whatever's left is up for grabs!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minionsNodeContext: Angry pep talk.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: Now we're going to - Wait! Who're you? And how did you get in there?!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minions - but turns to you when he realises you're near.NodeContext: Cut off mid sentence by the realisation that the player is nearby. Challenges them. They just appeared through a door that was supposedly secure.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: That crypt's ours - we've got people guarding it! Tryin' to off us and swipe the loot, is it?
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: NodeContext: Anger, with a little confusion. Assumes we're rivals trying to poach his loot.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Player
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: You have awoken me from my slumber - now I crave your blood!

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: C-c'mon, you lot, let's get out of here!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gimblebock addresses his minions, telling them to flee.NodeContext: Nerves showing a little as he orders his underlings to retreat. He's bottled it.

AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.text: How the hells did that happen?!
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: seeing a companion crushed by a boulder - he thinks it was an accident but is unnerved

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.VB_Fissure_1: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.
session_synopses.EntranceDoor:
This is the same character as Andorn, the bandit guard within the chapel.

This character is talking to the players through a door - he's locked the door and is on the other side, so they'll be talking TO the door and can't see him.

The player is talking to a gullible bandit through a door - the bandit is inside a chapel dungeon and his friends are outside. The player has probably either killed them or scared them away at this point. The guard is not very bright...
session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart: The player lockpicked the crypt door that shadowheart was trying to bash.
session_synopses.BanditBackInteraction_Spotted: Right outside of the abandonned chapel of Selune you encounter a few bandits arguing among themselves. They are rightfully surprise to see you get out of the ruins and worried about the fate of their friend inside.
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees one of his friends crushed (dead) by a boulder and doesn't have a great deal of sympathy
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.
session_synopses.Bandit_Melee_01_Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Gimblebock - the leader of the bandits who're looting the ruined chapel near where the player first wakes up. Gimblebock's answers are fragmented, cryptic. He can only draw on info that he knew when he was alive, and will refuse to speak to his killer if he recognises them. After a maximum of five questions, he'll fall silent for good.

session_synopses.VB_Trap: You click on a broken trap on the ground and find it useless.

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Narrator
AD_FL1Mural.context: NodeContext: Narrator describes a plaque written in a dead language

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Player
AD_FL1Mural.text: A dead tongue. Whoever worshipped here must be long gone.

AD_OutsideStatue.speaker: Narrator
AD_OutsideStatue.text: *Time and the elements have left the plaque unreadable.*
AD_OutsideStatue.context: NodeContext: Narrator describes an illegible plaque.

session_synopses.AD_FL1Mural: The player reads a plaque attached to a statue of Selune, the moon goddess. Shadowheart casually mocks it.
session_synopses.AD_OutsideStatue: The player tries to read a bronze plaque at the foot of an unidentified statue.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Quick - back to the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_LaezelCombatComment.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelCombatComment.text: Let me down, and we will prove our people's might!

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: Zorru was right. Yellow as a toad, and twice as ugly.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: You're coming with me, 'fore... Oh! Looks like I've got company.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Shadowheart
TieflingsScene.text: We can't trust her - her kin nearly got us killed when they attacked the nautiloid.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.text: I can't remain here. It's too dangerous.

AD_OpenCage2.speaker: Damays
AD_OpenCage2.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

PickASide.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide.text: Prove you're not a craven. Join me, or die.
PickASide.context: InternalNodeContext: The player took their leave in the dialog, or perhaps they failed all the persuasions, so the tieflings are acting on their own and wants to bring Lae'zel to camp

PickASide.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide.text: You've but one chance. Join me, or die.
PickASide.context: InternalNodeContext: The player persuaded the tieflings that they should kill the creature

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: Th-thank you. I couldn't have done it without you.

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: But I've got to go. I need to check out that blast.

LaezelDead.speaker: Player
LaezelDead.text: A blast? Care to be more specific?

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so I came for a look.

session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelCombatComment: A random combat was dragged up to Lae'zel Recruitment (bandits, brains, etc.); Lae'zel is still in the cage. She says  this AD only once, after a player's turn.
session_synopses.TieflingsScene: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat2: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage2: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.PickASide: Occurs if the player tells the tieflings to lower Lae'zel and kill her, or if player lets the tieflings try to take her away. One last chance to choose a side.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCageLaezel: Lae'zel is still hanging in her cage. She calls to you to let her down.
session_synopses.LaezelDead: You helped two tieflings kill a strange creature. (Lae'zel.) You talk to them, and they tell you about a blast they heard. (The ship crash.)

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *At the back of the crevice lies a bag, enfolded in the chitinous squabbling of spiders. A shiny gold coin pokes from its mouth.*
Crevice.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks into the crevice. We see a bag at the bottom with a coin sticking out.

Crevice.speaker: Player
Crevice.text: Attune yourself to the spiders' natural rhythm.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *The creatures clutch the pouch possessively. You have no doubt: a spider egg is nestled within.*

Crevice.speaker: Player
Crevice.text: Speak softly to the spiders in hopes of calming them.

session_synopses.Crevice: The player peeks into a crevice to see a coin pouch covered in small spiders.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: What're Gimblebock and the others doing up there?
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.context: NodeContext: Wondering out loud - something's amiss.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: Maybe we should go take a look.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: Not a chance - could be a trap. Just keep your eyes peeled.

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: Quite the question. What's the reason for it?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So I ask again: what is the worth of a single mortal life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: No one life is worth more than any other. We are all equal.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: We have met and I know thy face.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: We will see each other again at the proper time and place. Farewell.

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.speaker: Player
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.text: No lock, no handle. How does it open?
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.context: NodeContext: found a door without a lock or handle

AD_BanditGuardSpotting.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSpotting.context: NodeContext: A bandit searching an abandoned chapel - he's just been surprised by the player. He thought he was alone here with his crew and is startled and calls for help as combat begins

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: I pity anyone caught by those things. We were lucky to get out with the loot.

AD_BanditLockpickerCallHelp.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerCallHelp.context: NodeContext: surprised by players - calls for help from her companions and prepares for battle

AD_JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
AD_JergalWandering.text: What a mess the ages cause.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: At least there's no skeletons this time.
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself... the last time he tried something like this, skeletons attacked him.

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.text: Not even sure this is a door.
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That's Jergal, Scribe of the Dead. I didn't think anyone still worshipped him.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: I feel a presence here - a power. The patron god of this place?
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Player is stepping into an abandoned chapel and still feels the holy presence of the goddess Selune (seh-LOON-eh). She is a tranquil, protective deity.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: Whoever that even is. No intact symbols here, no dedications - nothing.
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Mocking her companion's pious reference to the moon goddess, of whom she is no fan.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.text: Clear off - we got here first!
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.context: NodeContext: seeing a threat, preparing to attack

session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation: player finds a door that has no lock or handle
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSpotting: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerCallHelp: A bandit is surprised by the players who have found a secret entry into an abandoned chapel she was looting with her companions. She calls for help.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_JergalWandering: Jergal wanders around after his conversation with the player, waiting for them to leave so he can teleport to camp and speak to them again later.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking: A bandit in an abandoned chapel - she's trying and failing to open a door to the lower level of the chapel, searching for loot. Talking to herself as she struggles - confused by the fact the door doesn't have a lock.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumAlert: Barton is alerted and tells the other bandits inside the room to get ready in their positions.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart: A mystic comments that they feel the power that once resided in an abandoned chapel. Shadowheart responds. Neither of them recognise which god this place is dedicated to.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSpotting: The bandit in the chapel's inner sanctum spots the player and starts combat.
